title: Introductory analysis of rat'l rad. function

content.question:
Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp daWcaaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaWdaeaapeWaaOaaa8aabaWdbiaadIhapa WaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaakiabgkHiTiaaisdaaSqabaaaaaaa @3FEB@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(a) Find the domain of f.

frqParts.text:
Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp daWcaaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaWdaeaapeWaaOaaa8aabaWdbiaadIhapa WaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaakiabgkHiTiaaisdaaSqabaaaaaaa @3FEB@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(a) Find the domain of f.
(b) Write an equation for each vertical asymptote to the graph of f.
(c) Write an equation for each horizontal asymptote to the graph of f.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
